name: belligerence
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
disapproving the wish to fight or argue: I can't stand his belligerence. She said, with a trace of belligerence, "I'm afraid you'll be wasting your time with me".
formal the act of starting or fighting a war: A spike in global oil prices could be caused by one country's belligerence. Related word
belligerent
More examplesFewer examplesBattling families often take pride in the belligerence of their youths.He is a blowhard whose belligerence masks personal pain.When belligerence and hostility become the favorite form of political entertainment, no good can come of it.Terrorism is a new and unprecedented form of belligerence, a new form of war.
